channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overhanging vegetation of 241 Days Lane is causing access issues to the pavement opposite Days Lane Primary School, 6th November
item.description:
Overhanging vegetation of 241 Days Lane is causing access issues to the pavement opposite Days Lane Primary School - this has been previously reported and states it is now closed as it has been sorted out but still nothing has been done. Young children and adults use the pavement daily (Ref; 8148103) - please can someone look into this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 241, Days Lane, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Increased fly tipping and rubbish, 6th November
item.description:
Even more bags of clothing suitcases full of rubbish and litter being left all over the street. For weeks now the street has been littered with fly tip issues and only getting worse with the windy weather and foxes going through belongings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ceres Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not fixed!, 6th November
item.description:
The resident from number 48 Brinklow Crescent is regularly placing household bins on the public road to prevent anyone parking outside their house. This has been happening for many years and obstructs legitimate parking on an already busy residential road where parking is limited. The bins are often left out even when it is not collection day, and this behaviour makes it harder for other residents to find parking. Under Section 1 of the Royal Borough of Greenwich's Anti-Social Behaviour Policy, behaviour that is capable of causing nuisance or annoyance to any person living in, working in, or visiting the neighbourhood can be considered anti- social. The repeated placement of bins in the carriageway to block parking clearly causes nuisance and inconvenience to other residents. Please investigate and advise the resident that this behaviour is not permitted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brinklow Crescent, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
